title: Sir Alex Ferguson will want Manchester United to snap up John McGinn, says former scout
text:
Sir Alex Ferguson will recommend Manchester United to sign John McGinn, according to a former Aston Villa scout.

Bobby Jenks, who had helped bring the Scottish winger to England, believes that Ferguson will urge Old Trafford chiefs to move for the Villa star.

The former United manager still holds a sizeable influence over the club and reportedly wanted the top flight giants to swoop for McGinn in the summer.

Sir Alex Ferguson will recommend Manchester United to sign John McGinn, says an ex-scout

According to The Sun, the Premier League newcomers demanded £50million for the 24-year-old, who has scored three goals in his six league appearances this season.

But ex-scout Jenks, who had formerly worked at Villa Park, believes Ferguson will again attempt to convince United to complete a swoop.

He told The Athletic: 'He's up there with the best-performing midfielders in the division.

'Wait until he's had a year at that level and then we can say more.

'What I do know is that Sir Alex Ferguson is wondering why Manchester United let a talented Scottish boy slip through.

The former United boss had reportedly urged the the club to move for the Scot in the summer

'He'll be keeping a close eye on him that's for sure and if he continues the way he is, you can bet he'll be telling his pals at United, too.'

The same publication reports that Jenks had implored the Midlands outfit to snap up McGinn throughout the 2017-18 campaign, and would provide information on his background and playing style.

But Jenks was soon sacked after a string of cutbacks at the club, and Villa later completed the deal despite scouts not initially being sold on the Scot's qualities.
description: Bobby Jenks, who had helped bring the Scottish winger to England, believes that Ferguson will urge Old Trafford chiefs to move for the Villa star.
